explain: Complete electrical failure with rapid clicking and dim lights indicates severely discharged or dead battery.
recommendation: üîã Charge or replace battery. Check for parasitic drain. Test alternator output.

explain: No cranking with dead dashboard suggests main power interruption - check battery connections, main fuses, or ignition switch.
recommendation: ‚ö° Check battery terminals, main fuse box, and ignition switch wiring.

explain: Normal cranking without starting plus strong gasoline smell indicates fuel flooding in cylinders.
recommendation: ‚õΩ Hold accelerator pedal to floor while cranking to clear flood. Check fuel injectors.

explain: Engine cranks but won't start with empty fuel gauge strongly suggests out of fuel condition.
recommendation: üõ¢Ô∏è Add fuel immediately. Check for fuel system damage from running dry.

explain: Single loud clunk without cranking indicates starter solenoid engaging but not activating starter motor.
recommendation: üîß Replace starter solenoid or entire starter assembly. Check starter wiring.

explain: Slow labored cranking with clicking and dim lights indicates weak battery unable to provide sufficient cranking amps.
recommendation: üîã Test battery voltage under load. Charge or replace battery. Check charging system.

explain: No cranking with security light flashing confirms anti-theft system is preventing engine start.
recommendation: üîí Use key fob to disarm system. Check key battery. Try spare key. Consult dealer if persistent.

explain: Cranking without starting after water exposure suggests moisture in ignition components (coils, plugs, wires).
recommendation: üíß Dry ignition components with compressed air. Check for water in spark plug wells.

explain: Engine starts then stalls with Check Engine Light indicates critical sensor failure (crankshaft, camshaft, MAF).
recommendation: üìü Scan for trouble codes. Check crankshaft/camshaft sensors, MAF sensor connections.

explain: Rough idle with Check Engine Light suggests ignition misfire from faulty coils, plugs, or injectors.
recommendation: ‚ö° Scan for misfire codes. Check spark plugs, ignition coils, fuel injectors.

explain: Grinding noise during cranking indicates damaged starter pinion or flywheel ring gear teeth.
recommendation: üîß Replace starter assembly. Inspect flywheel ring gear for damage.

explain: Corroded/loose battery terminals with clicking sounds confirm poor electrical connections preventing proper current flow.
recommendation: üîå Clean and tighten battery terminals. Check ground connections. Apply terminal protector.

explain: White exhaust smoke on startup may indicate coolant entering combustion chambers (head gasket issue).
recommendation: üå´Ô∏è Perform compression test. Check for coolant in oil. May require head gasket replacement.

explain: Cranking without starting after recent electrical work suggests incorrect installation or wiring issues.
recommendation: üîß Review recent electrical work. Check wiring connections, fuses, and relays.

explain: Recent jump-start with slow cranking indicates alternator not properly charging battery.
recommendation: üîã Test alternator output. Replace alternator if not charging. Check drive belt tension.

explain: Cranks but won't start with Check Engine Light suggests failure of critical engine management sensor.
recommendation: üìü Scan for diagnostic codes. Check crankshaft position sensor, camshaft sensor, fuel pump relay.

explain: No cranking after water exposure indicates water damage to starter motor or solenoid.
recommendation: üíß Replace starter motor. Check for water in starter housing and wiring.

explain: Stalling after start with gasoline smell suggests fuel pressure loss after initial prime.
recommendation: ‚õΩ Check fuel pump pressure. Inspect fuel lines, filter, and pressure regulator.
